website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost hammer suitable for auto body work. Powerful yet gentle on vulnerable surfaces.
pros: Color stands out among other tools
cons: Despite one-piece construction, hammer is not as durable as some other choices

customer_reviews.title: It needs full disclosure in listing.
customer_reviews.text: I've needed a hammer like this to install paver bricks on my patio. Thought i was getting a good deal.The hammer arrived with a warning label that it contains a chemical known to cause cancer and you should wash your hands after using it. Didn't see that in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: I'm just saying

customer_reviews.title: What good is a hammer that can't hammer?
customer_reviews.text: May be okay for very light work, but I tried to use it to dislodge a large flat brass piece that I didn't want damaged and the end of the hammer began shredding into bits immediately. Within 10 swings the metal cap dislodged from one end and the shot load came flying out across the room. Very cheap construction. Save your money by spending a little more for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: rambunctiousralph

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Good quality feel
customer_reviews.text: Its really nice, even though its injection mould, the weighty feel gives it a more high quality feel. I use it a lot with the beach tents to hammer the tent sticks to the ground, works perfectly and especially since its a plastic which will lasts a long time even if it gets salt and water splashed on it. Compared to a metal one and the color is also excellent to find it easily and evenwhen it's dark.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Where's me mallet?  Right there!
customer_reviews.text: I use this dead blow hammer to tap on box end wrenches when a little persuasion is needed on stubborn bolts - in tight spaces. Specifically - I service a piece of equipment that has bolts in such a place that an impact gun or breaker bar with socket won't touch. This mallet is more gentle on my wrenches than a ball peen hammer is.
customer_reviews.author: Brant

customer_reviews.title: Now my neighbors are all calling me 'Thor' again...
customer_reviews.text: After a tragic boating accident during which my old hammer was lost, this, along with my belt, iron gloves, and staff, have allowed me to resume my mountain crushing and the smiting of my enemies. These days, I can only summon up time on Thorsdays for these endeavors...and this hammer is always ready, willing, and able to assist me!
customer_reviews.author: pcsutton

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nice deadblow for the money. At time of purchase $8.96 with delivery I could not pass up. I'm a serious DYI with 5 cars to maintain. Suspensions is where this comes in very handy. Everyone needs a deadblow at home for demolition or a stroke harder than a rubber mallet. I have many tools and various brands Neiko is a great value for hand tools. I have more than one of their tools.
customer_reviews.author: P. Viola

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER MUST-HAVE TOOL
customer_reviews.text: I have used this only a couple of times at this point however it seems to work well. It's nice to have soft and heavy hammer that will get the job done without marring surfaces. It helped release a stubborn pool ladder as well as some rust welded wheels on my vehicle while swapping out wheels for the season. A must have for the DIYer, this one is a little big but good for my needs. A full set would be ideal. Only time will tell long-term durability.
customer_reviews.author: Cardo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at very low cost
customer_reviews.text: Used for a variety of purposes including gently installing an IMS bearing in Porsche engine. Quality, solid feel, very easy to control, and the dead-blow aspect works as expected to eliminate "bounce" on impact. Definitely non-marring on any reasonable metal surface or part. I would not suggest any lighter weight for most auto work. There is a 5 lb version that might be better for heavier tasks, but this is a very good "middle" weight that should work for most tasks.
customer_reviews.author: bobatious

customer_reviews.title: Poor name, great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a Stanley that was very old and worn out. Like the bright color and works well. The name makes it sound like you need to use it to kill something but the name is about all that is wrong with it. I mainly use it to seat joints on woodworking projects.
customer_reviews.author: Astroman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping to split fire wood, dead-blow feature drives splitter wedge through logs with minimal rebounds, covering on hammer eliminates sparking when striking splitting wedge.
customer_reviews.author: james keough

customer_reviews.title: You’ll love it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dead blow. Perfect for starting bearings on shafts. Even after hitting things with a sharp edge, the hammer faces haven’t deformed or cracked. It’s well balanced and the throw in the shot is perfect. I would say it holds a standard comparable to proto but for 1/4 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Not a good hammer
customer_reviews.text: So the appeal is that it’s less fatigue inducing.. but I’d argue it’s just as fatiguing if not more than a normal hammer because of the movement inside the hammer while swinging. I’m a land surveyor and wanted to try something outside the norm. This hammer can’t even drive a PK nail or drive a hub into grass. Buy a normal sledge.
customer_reviews.author: TravyT

customer_reviews.title: Great quality deadblow
customer_reviews.text: Great quality deadblow. I use this on everything from setting up parts in my CNC machine to leveling out pavers for a sidewalk. I got two, one stays in the shop, the other is used for rougher stuff, but both seem to be holding up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley M.

customer_reviews.title: Hammer
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is exactly what I needed for making different craft projects that required me to heat metal. The quality is good and also not heavy at all if you are going to be using it for a few hours, like is my case.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Just like every other one.
customer_reviews.text: works great. its a standard 2 lb. orange dead blow hammer. nice hand grip, Shakes like a Maraca, what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.author: collin colberg

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was cheap and on sale. I might use it once or twice a year. It's good to have and doesn't feel poor quality. Happy with my purchase though I really didn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not as useful as I had hoped. I got this for punching leather but it doesnt seem heavy enough for a decent impact . Ill be looking for a different affordable dead blow
customer_reviews.author: Arby186

customer_reviews.title: Great for pounding meat!
customer_reviews.text: I am a chef and i use this hammer to pound meat. It is completely sealed in plastic so it is easy to clean and sanitize. My schnitzel has never been better!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Blows we’re certainly dead and that’s a good thing. Some of the orange coating did chip a bit taking away a star. It got the job done and didn’t break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meadors

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good price
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used this hammer a lot but it appears to do what a dead blow hammer is suppose to do and looks to be quite durable
customer_reviews.author: joshbenmichael

customer_reviews.title: Great 2lb dead blow hammer!
customer_reviews.text: I love the length of this hammer! Feels good has a rubber like grip feeling. Not slippery like the old one I had.
customer_reviews.author: DAY-VER

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I beat the hell out of this hammer against a few automotive applicationS. Solid. I would recommend a heavier one for differential set up but this one performs as should
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I didn't need a heavy duty dead blow hammer and for what I needed this works great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Loose sand badly affecting its use
customer_reviews.text: Junk they put sand in it for weight but it moves around bad that affects your blows with it . I should of known by the price but sometimes you get something alright that’s cheap but not this
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Did it's job of banging off some rust welded rotors on my car, next time I'd go with somethign a little heavier, but it still got it done.
customer_reviews.author: Kailoha

customer_reviews.title: "Heavy" duty tool.
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy for what I needed it for. Should've ordered the 1lb, but didn't because I didn't like having to pay for shipping to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good weight for a dead blow hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Great deadblow hammer.the only reason I bought this one is the older one 30 years old became brittle and started to break when I used it.
customer_reviews.author: vince m.

customer_reviews.title: Thought I bought the wrong tool but this was great.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a job of driving in lawn staples. The hammer was heavier than I realized (my fault). The tool worked great. I'm sure I'll use it for more jobs in the future. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Not solid hammer head and very thin rubber
customer_reviews.text: I am a glazier by trade I have had this dead blow since April 3 and within one month the head has come completely failed leading to exposed metal in the head leading to damage of products
customer_reviews.author: Mickel

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, satisfying blows
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a tool to drive in stakes for camping and for gardening. I love the bright orange color - I never lose it in my messy garage, or around the campsite even in low light. I've never had a dead blow hammer before and the sensation of the hits from it are very satisfying - heavy and no rebound. Been using this a lot, and my young sons have, too, and it's very durable.
customer_reviews.author: zachinoakland

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: It’s a dead blow hammer, depending on how savage you are will depend on how long it lasts
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: mallet
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say! It is a solid made rubber mallet well balanced and great price!
customer_reviews.author: zengoose10

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great for special situations. Working on wood construction installing wooden plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly what I order. The quality of the product was great.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice hammer with a good feel and grip. The cover cleans up quickly and doesn't smudge. Delivers a solid and controllable blow.
customer_reviews.author: P. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last like a Stanley
customer_reviews.text: While it gets the job done, this tool does not last. The rubber/plastic outside tears and breaks down quickly. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. H. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Great dead blow hammer
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great dead blow for working on cars in the garage. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: emmapeele

customer_reviews.title: no need for a review
customer_reviews.text: it does what its supposed too! I use it regularly and have had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: D0m

customer_reviews.title: I am a woman and I can do it. It is easy.
customer_reviews.text: It is great for my sakes when my sunflowers need them.
customer_reviews.author: karen Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Good tool as long as not abused
customer_reviews.text: Will not take abuse, thay being said if you use it as intended works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M couture II

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Smokytriscuit

customer_reviews.title: I like it it's a pretty Orange
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it's a hammer, just stay on my way.
customer_reviews.author: Delmer Newton

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good grip on it, but don't know how good it is. Only used it a few times & it works.
customer_reviews.author: DIXIEHUNTRESS

customer_reviews.title: Not for camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mallet to put tent stakes in the ground for a camping trip- it was too much of a hassle using it for this purpose. It’s well made and a solid weight but it didn’t serve the purpose I needed it for. I read the description prior- good product bad product description.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos C

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Time!
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to use this. Bought it to pound some rotors off my car.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M

customer_reviews.title: WA-POW
customer_reviews.text: Great for scarring my dog and not damaging things I'm trying to knock loose.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Deadblow hammer
customer_reviews.text: This came well recommended. I use it regularly and am quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Donald H.

customer_reviews.title: It is an inexpensive dead blow mallet
customer_reviews.text: This works. I couldn’t find anything less expensive. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works well, used on muffler install, good size and weight
customer_reviews.author: K. A.

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built for a cheap price and it did the job I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fuego

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great hammer compare to the rubber hammer which black rubber came off when used it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great no bounce hammer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and works great. I use it for woodworking (chiseling).
customer_reviews.author: William Gray

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I keep it handy in my pick up for hooking up my horse trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good hammer - worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this hammer after my 20 year old dead blow hammer snapped. This is a great little hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: T-man
customer_reviews.text: Came with big chunks out of the hammer head was very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super buy
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great hammer especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be of good quality and works as expected.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...
customer_reviews.text: We needed this to cut up frozen meats and this is the perfect implement.
customer_reviews.author: Kailua Girl

customer_reviews.title: Poor balance
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item because the handle and dead-blow head were poorly balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and good for wood carving
customer_reviews.text: started to use this mallet for light wood chiselling, works great for someone without a lot of upper body strength
customer_reviews.author: Fiona H

customer_reviews.title: It is a dead blow hammer.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should, a bit cheap as far as durability, but prices accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Joey B

customer_reviews.title: Dead blow hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great tool cushioned blows and cutting down on vibration!
customer_reviews.author: Big Joe

customer_reviews.title: This does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small size dead blow / drop hammer to use on fretts on a guutar. I didn't want to spend a fortune. This does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It's great!!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work well for what I bought it for but it has been very useful for other things!
customer_reviews.author: L.Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to loosen ice on wood deck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to break ice on my wood deck. I hope it holds up in the cold. I'll update if it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: KotyMouse

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent dead blow hammer. The face took a beating in a floor install but it still is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weigele

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate weight of hammer.
customer_reviews.text: This supposedly 1 pound hammer, actually weighs 1.7 pounds. Way heavier than I wanted to adjust items at my table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Palo Alto Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight of the hammer and the sharp color
customer_reviews.author: fran

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good soft face hammer, good grip on the handle, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon V Hokanson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, does exactly what I wanted it to do
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Is what it should be... A cheap dead blow. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: chase s.

customer_reviews.title: Me
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted....and boy is it ORANGE!! it won't get lost!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I use it at work frequently. This was a great buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammer great weight to it and feel like it gonna last a long long time .
customer_reviews.author: Manman

customer_reviews.title: It takes the beating.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good dead blow hammer, its not a solid hammer though. It has like bb's inside.
customer_reviews.author: koala

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Color for an Awesome Whacker
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I've come to think a soft-faced, dead-blow hammer is just supposed to be this color. Low and behold... this one is-- oh my golly! My decision is made. Besides that I do like the size, shape and texture of the handle. On a more reserved observation, I notice it's made of vinyl. I expected some polymer better known for durability. For that reason, I'm sure I'll need to use care when deciding what to whack with the very pretty thing. Conversely this hammer face should not marr finished surfaces-- and that is usually the reason for selecting such a tool.
customer_reviews.author: FoesFly

customer_reviews.title: Do the job
customer_reviews.text: Like it, do the job, and no chance to lose it (orange flash 😉)
customer_reviews.author: Huysmans Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Neiko Dead Blow Hammer
customer_reviews.text: The product did not hold up to industrial use. After only one use, the face on one end of the hammer had broken down andthe hammer had to be disposed of as it was leaking shot.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Do it
customer_reviews.text: No issues here. Great price, great tool. Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Rice

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Hammer broke after a couple uses.
customer_reviews.author: larry greathouse

customer_reviews.title: I use this hammer to seat my fishing rod holders ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this hammer to seat my fishing rod holders into the ground.I've been on 6-8 trips and the hammer is starting to crack in several places.Next time I will purchase a brass mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Dead blow hammer
customer_reviews.text: I have had a UK made version in my workshop for years, this one was a present to my son living in the USA; I hope he finds it equally useful
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Brian Wood

customer_reviews.title: Single-molded mallet is key!
customer_reviews.text: After 3-4 years of use, the head on my common black-rubber headed wooden handle mallet flew off while staking out my tent over Memorial Day weekend. I was still able to place the head back on the handle and carefully stake out the rest of my tent, but it made me aware of the importance of a mallet where the head AND handle are all one piece! Definitely go for the single-mold when searching for a mallet. It easily fits into (and now lives in) the stuff backpack of our REI Kingdom 4 tent also.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be able to take some abuse before cracking and pitting
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A

product_meta.title: Neiko 02847A 2 LB Dead Blow Hammer, Neon Orange I Unibody Molded | Checkered Grip | Spark and Rebound Resistant
product_meta.description: Size:2 lb.2-lb Dead Blow Hammer with Extra force design, steel shot-filled head and easy-grip, non-slip handle, Neon Orange
feature_bullets: Steel shot filled head adds extra force to hammer blows and eliminates rebound & spark making it ideal for auto body work
Unicast poly molded body prevents hammer from wearing away between the head and handle and material prevents sparks upon impact
Diamond textured non-slip handle grip comfortably keeps hammer in your hands after impact
Bright color makes it easy to locate in worksites and differentiate between other hammers in your tool kit
Hammer dimensions: 2-1/8" x 3-7/8" Head, overall Length: 13-3/8"; 2-Pound Head

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars666 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
